title: Gareth Bale is fed up of using his famous ‘man bun’ to cover his bald patch he is now considering a hair transplant
text:
EFL They think it's comb-over Gareth Bale is fed up of using his famous ‘man bun’ to cover his bald patch he is now considering a hair transplant 
The Welsh footie wizard has been stretching strands across his bare spot Exclusive 18th March 2017, 10:00 pm Updated: 19th March 2017, 2:58 am Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments GARETH Bale uses his famous “man bun” to hide that he is going bald and is considering a hair transplant. 5 Gareth Bale’s bald spot appears through his ‘man bun’ 
Real Madrid superstar Bale, 27, was stung by tweets about his thinning thatch after it was glimpsed during his heroics for Wales at Euro 2016. 
The source said: “Gareth’s been trying to cover up his bald patch for a while by tying his hair in the bun. He now wants to get it sorted.” 
Crystal Palace midfielder Joe Ledley, 30, a fellow Wales player and a close pal, is said to have recommended KSL Hair, which charges up to £10,000 for hair transplant treatment that takes one day at clinics in Cardiff, Glasgow and Kent. Getty Images 5 The Welsh ace with his ‘man bun’ in tact during Madrid game 
The source said: “Gareth’s been speaking to Joe, who has taken the plunge to book an appointment. 
“He’s followed suit and has it lined up after his season finishes in May.” 
“Both of them will be out the limelight for a while so it gives the hair plenty of time to settle in while the cameras aren’t watching them every week.” Getty Images Bale with Wales manager Chris Coleman during Euro 2016 Getty Images - WireImage Gareth with long-term partner Emma Rhys-Jones MOST READ IN FOOTBALL Manchester United star Marcos Rojo drug tested after eating a banana in win over Rostov 'You will see' Arsene Wenger reveals he HAS made up his mind over future after latest horror show at the Hawthorns... but will not tell of his plans yet MIDFIELD ENGINE N'Golo Kante drives around in a modest Mini as Chelsea team-mates collect supercars... and we can reveal why Spurred on Tottenham have the second most valuable squad in all of Europe, behind only La Liga giants Barcelona 'I CONTEMPLATED SUICIDE' Rio Ferdinand reveals how he turned to alcohol after death of his wife - and could 'understand' why people commit suicide Game of two other halves Man-of-the-match accidentally thanks his wife... and then his GIRLFRIEND in the greatest post-game interview ever Times Newspapers Ltd Gareth sporting fuller locks during his time at Spurs 
KSL Hair yesterday declined to comment. 
Balding Manchester United star Wayne Rooney, 31, underwent similar treatment at the Harley Street Hair Clinic in London. Gareth Bale shows of his talent with outrageous football skills
